title: Fix transparent submit confirmation dialog background on Test Page

requirements.text: In TestPage.tsx, fix the 'Submit Test?' confirmation dialog/modal so that its overlay uses a solid dark background (e.g. rgba(0,0,0,0.85) or bg-gray-900) and the dialog card itself uses a solid white background (#FFFFFF) with navy (#0A1F44) text. The dialog currently renders with a transparent or semi-transparent background, causing the underlying question content to show through and making the confirmation text ('Submit Test?', 'You have answered X out of Y questions...'), the 'Submit Now' button, and the 'Continue Test' button unreadable. Remove all transparent or translucent background styles from the confirmation dialog overlay and card.

quotes: see screenshot clearly after sumbiting test message see like this transparent so please this message background create dark white solid

acceptanceCriteria: The submit confirmation dialog overlay has a solid dark background (rgba(0,0,0,0.85) or equivalent) — no underlying page content is visible through the overlay.
The dialog card has a solid white (#FFFFFF) background — no transparency or translucency.
All text in the dialog ('Submit Test?', unanswered question warning) is clearly readable in navy (#0A1F44) on the white card.
The 'Submit Now' button is clearly visible with solid navy (#0A1F44) background and white text.
The 'Continue Test' button is clearly visible with appropriate solid styling.
The fix applies on both mobile and desktop viewports.

constraints: Do not modify any files listed under frontend.immutablePaths.
All styling must remain consistent with the existing Navy Blue (#0A1F44) and White theme.
nonGoals: Changing the submit confirmation logic or flow.
Redesigning the test page layout beyond the dialog background fix.
